reference.title: Resource requirements for master and delegate hosts

section.p: requires real or virtual hosts that implement the 64-bit version of the x86 instruction set, and support Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7.1 or 7.2 or CentOS 7.1 or 7.2. You can deploy with multiple hosts or a single host.An under-resourced master host cannot function properly. Ensure that you deploy and applications on a master host that meets the application's minimum requirements.

section.title: Multi-host deployments
section.p:
For best results, production deployments include one master host and two or more delegate hosts. In this configuration,
The master host runs in its own, separate resource pool, and runs only internal services. Minimum resource requirements for the master host are listed in the following table.
Delegate hosts require resources that are adequate to support all application services assigned to the host's resource pool. Identical resources are required for all delegate hosts in a resource pool. For more information, refer to your application documentation.

section.title: Single-host deployments
section.p: In a single-host deployment, the host runs all internal services and all application services. Minimum resource requirements for the master host functions are listed in the following table. The host also requires adequate resources to support the services assigned to the resource pool. For more information, refer to your application documentation.
